Package net.demilich.metastone.game.spells.desc

Enum SpellArg

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<SpellArg>
      • net.demilich.metastone.game.spells.desc.SpellArg
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<SpellArg>
    public enum SpellArg
extends java.lang.Enum<SpellArg>
    This enum describes the keys to the SpellDesc / the keys of the dictionaries in the CardDesc card JSON files for spells.}

    To see how a particular argument is interpreted, refer to the Java Spell class written in the CLASS field of the SpellDesc. For example, if you see the spell: 

       {
     "class": "DrawCardSpell",
     "value": 1
   }
    Observe that VALUE corresponds to the key "value" in this JSON. All the fields in the JSON in camelCase have a corresponding field name in UPPER_CASE. To see what "value" / VALUE means in this context, visit DrawCardSpell.

    Observe that every SpellArg enum value is a key in the JSON for spell effects, except camelCased and surrounded by quotation marks. When you read documentation for Spell subclasses and you see a SpellArg referred to there, assume the documentation is telling you to write a camelCased version of the SpellArg into the JSON to get the effect you want. For example, if the documentation says that EXCLUSIVE, when set to true, does something, you'll write something like this in the JSON: 

       {
     ...
     "exclusive": true
   }
    Whenever a new entry is added here, a corresponding deserialization instruction must be authoered in DescDeserializer.init(DescDeserializer.SerializationContext). If a new type is added (the right hand side of the JSON key/value pair), a new ParseValueType needs to be added.
    See Also:
    for the formal type of the values of these enum keys.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant Description
      ARMOR_BONUS
      The amount of armor to buff to an entity, which is almost always only a hero.
      ATTACK_BONUS
      The amount of attack to buff to an entity.
      ATTRIBUTE
      Indicates an attribute for the spell, typically the one being added, removed, targeted or filtered.
      AURA
      Indicates an aura, typically one that will be put into play on a target.
      BATTLECRY
      Specifies a battlecry as a BattlecryDesc that will soon be added by a AddBattlecrySpell.
      BOARD_POSITION_ABSOLUTE
      This argument is added by the resolution of GameLogic.resolveDeathrattles(Player, Actor).
      BOARD_POSITION_RELATIVE
      Typically interpreted as a position relative to the source of a spell.
      CANNOT_RECEIVE_OWNED
      When true, indicates DiscoverSpell should not show a card the player already has in his hand.
      CARD
      Interpreted as the card the spell is acting on.
      CARD_COST_MODIFIER
      Describes a CardCostModifier for the CardCostModifierSpell.
      CARD_DESC_TYPE
      Deprecated.
      CARD_FILTER
      An EntityFilter that typically operates on cards.
      CARD_FILTERS
      Deprecated.
      CARD_LOCATION
      A value from Zones that represents a place to or from a card will be affected.
      CARD_SOURCE
      A CardSource that specifies an original list of cards that should be filtered, typically with a CARD_FILTER.
      CARD_TYPE
      Used by the CreateCardSpell to determine what kind of card to make.
      CARDS
      An array version of CARD.
      CLASS
      The Java subclass of Spell, located in the net.demilich.metastone.game.spells or net.demilich.metastone.game.spells.custom (when prefixed with "custom.") packages in this module.
      CONDITION
      A Condition that is evaluated against a target.
      CONDITIONS
      The array version of CONDITION.
      DEATHRATTLE_ID
      Specifies a unique integer ID for a SpellDesc that is also a deathrattle, to allow deathrattles to identify themselves inside iterators for HasDeathrattleEnchantments.getDeathrattleEnchantments().
      DESCRIPTION
      A piece of text that gets written on the card using the SetDescriptionSpell, or a description to appear on a generated card in a CastFromGroupSpell.
      EXCLUSIVE
      A typically catch-all boolean argument.
      FILTER
      An EntityFilter that is applied to the targets returned by the TARGET or TargetSelection specified on the CardDesc.getTargetSelection().
      FULL_MANA_CRYSTALS
      When true, indicates to ModifyMaxManaSpell whether it should give a player full or empty mana crystals.
      GROUP
      For internal use only.
      HOW_MANY
      For spells where VALUE has a separate interpretation from "copies" or "duplicates," this arg is typically used to indicate copies or duplicates.
      HP_BONUS
      Used by BuffSpell to indicate how much additional full-healed health should be given to the target as a buff.
      IGNORE_SPELL_DAMAGE
      Used by the DamageSpell to indicate that even though this effect is written on a spell card, the amount of damage dealt (the VALUE) should not be affected by spell damage.
      MANA
      Deprecated.
      NAME
      Used by various spells to put a name on a card or to change the name of a target card.
      OPERATION
      An AlgebraicOperation that is typically used to do math.
      QUEST
      Used by AddQuestSpell to define a Quest to put into play.
      RACE
      Used by the SetRaceSpell to change a target minion's race.
      RANDOM_TARGET
      When true, indicates that a random single target from the list of filtered targets should be cast on by this spell.
      REVERT_TRIGGER
      Used by the RevertableSpell series of spells to indicate which EventTrigger will cause the effects to be "reverted."
      SECOND_REVERT_TRIGGER
      Used by the RevertableSpell series of spells to indicate another EventTrigger that will cause the effects to be "reverted."
      SECONDARY_NAME
      Deprecated.
      SECONDARY_TARGET
      Typically interpreted as a second target for effects that have a source, a target, and another entity that does something to the target.
      SECONDARY_VALUE
      Indicates a second value.
      SECRET
      Used by the AddSecretSpell to define a Secret to put into play.
      SPELL
      Typically the SpellDesc that is cast with EntityReference.OUTPUT set to the result of the parent spell's effect; or, the spell that is cast when a Condition is met.
      SPELL1
      Like SPELL, a SpellDesc that's typically interpreted as the "first" or primary spell.
      SPELL2
      Like SPELL, a SpellDesc that's typically interpreted as the "second" or alternative spell.
      SPELLS
      An array of spells, used almost exclusively by MetaSpell as the spells to cast, one after another, or by ConditionalSpell, cast when the corresponding conditions in CONDITIONS are met.
      SUMMON_AURA
      For internal use only.
      SUMMON_BASE_ATTACK
      For internal use only.
      SUMMON_BASE_HP
      For internal use only.
      SUMMON_BATTLECRY
      For internal use only.
      SUMMON_CHARGE
      For internal use only.
      SUMMON_DEATHRATTLE
      For internal use only.
      SUMMON_DIVINE_SHIELD
      For internal use only.
      SUMMON_STEALTH
      For internal use only.
      SUMMON_TAUNT
      For internal use only.
      SUMMON_TRIGGERS
      For internal use only.
      SUMMON_WINDFURY
      For internal use only.
      TARGET
      Specifies the EntityReference on which this spell should be cast, overriding the target received from the parent or selected by the user.
      TARGET_PLAYER
      Indicates whose point of view this spell should be cast from.
      TARGET_SELECTION
      Deprecated.
      TRIGGER
      Specifies the EnchantmentDesc enchantment that should be created, typically by the AddEnchantmentSpell.
      TRIGGERS
      The plural version of TRIGGER.
      VALUE
      The value is either an integer or a ValueProvider which is typically interpreted as the amount or copies of an action.

      • CLASS

        The Java subclass of Spell, located in the net.demilich.metastone.game.spells or net.demilich.metastone.game.spells.custom (when prefixed with "custom.") packages in this module.

        public static final SpellArg ARMOR_BONUS

        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • ATTACK_BONUS

        public static final SpellArg ATTACK_BONUS
        The amount of attack to buff to an entity. Used by a few spells and auras.
        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • ATTRIBUTE

        public static final SpellArg ATTRIBUTE
        Indicates an attribute for the spell, typically the one being added, removed, targeted or filtered.
        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • AURA

        public static final SpellArg AURA
        Indicates an aura, typically one that will be put into play on a target.
        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • BOARD_POSITION_ABSOLUTE

        public static final SpellArg BOARD_POSITION_ABSOLUTE
        This argument is added by the resolution of GameLogic.resolveDeathrattles(Player, Actor). It stores the position of the minion before it died. This then gets used by spells like SummonSpell to summon a minion where the minion died.

        It may someday be interpreted by other spells to put an entity in a particular position.

        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • BOARD_POSITION_RELATIVE

        public static final SpellArg BOARD_POSITION_RELATIVE
        Typically interpreted as a position relative to the source of a spell.
        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • CANNOT_RECEIVE_OWNED

        public static final SpellArg CANNOT_RECEIVE_OWNED
        When true, indicates DiscoverSpell should not show a card the player already has in his hand.

      • CARD

        public static final SpellArg CARD
        Interpreted as the card the spell is acting on. It is typically the ID (file name of a card without the ".json" extension) of a card.

        This argument is fairly common. For a SummonSpell, it indicates which card to summon. For a ReceiveCardSpell, it indicates which card should be put in the player's hand.

        Many spells use a SpellUtils.getCards(GameContext, Player, Entity, Entity, SpellDesc, int) system to interpret a set of arguments (CARD being one of them) as a way to specify "a bunch of cards."

        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • CARD_COST_MODIFIER

        public static final SpellArg CARD_COST_MODIFIER
        Describes a CardCostModifier for the CardCostModifierSpell.

      • CARD_DESC_TYPE

        @Deprecated
public static final SpellArg CARD_DESC_TYPE
        Deprecated.
        Describes the kind of card created in a CreateCardSpell. Considered obsolete.

      • CARD_FILTER

        public static final SpellArg CARD_FILTER
        An EntityFilter that typically operates on cards. These cards are retrieved from a CardSource, which when not specified is the UnweightedCatalogueSource by default for random effects and CatalogueSource for discovers. Like CARD, it is used by pipelines like SpellUtils.getCards(GameContext, Player, Entity, Entity, SpellDesc, int) and SpellDesc.getFilteredCards(GameContext, Player, Entity) to generate a list of cards for some effect.

        This argument shouldn't be confused with CardFilter. Any EntityFilter can be on the right hand side of a "cardFilter".

        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg., for an arg that is commonly included with this arg., for more about entity filters.

      • CARD_FILTERS

        @Deprecated
public static final SpellArg CARD_FILTERS
        Deprecated.
        Multiple card filters that are used by effects like DiscoverFilteredCardSpell. Considered obsolete.

      • CARD_LOCATION

        public static final SpellArg CARD_LOCATION
        A value from Zones that represents a place to or from a card will be affected.
        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg., for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • CARD_SOURCE

        public static final SpellArg CARD_SOURCE
        A CardSource that specifies an original list of cards that should be filtered, typically with a CARD_FILTER. Common choices for a card source include CatalogueSource and UnweightedCatalogueSource.
        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg., for an arg that is commonly included with this arg., for more about card sources.

      • CARD_TYPE

        public static final SpellArg CARD_TYPE
        Used by the CreateCardSpell to determine what kind of card to make. Considered obsolete.

      • CARDS

        public static final SpellArg CARDS
        An array version of CARD. Typically interpreted as a group of cards, rather than as a random selection of one of these cards.
        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • CONDITION

        public static final SpellArg CONDITION
        A Condition that is evaluated against a target. It is typically interpreted as whether or not a spell should execute its subspell SPELL or do SPELL1 versus SPELL2 given the result of evaluating the condition.
        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • CONDITIONS

        public static final SpellArg CONDITIONS
        The array version of CONDITION.
        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • DESCRIPTION

        public static final SpellArg DESCRIPTION
        A piece of text that gets written on the card using the SetDescriptionSpell, or a description to appear on a generated card in a CastFromGroupSpell.

        Eventually, the value of this argument will support dynamic text generation and more advanced text manipulation.

      • EXCLUSIVE

        public static final SpellArg EXCLUSIVE
        A typically catch-all boolean argument.

        In many cases, this arg is interpreted to mean the difference between affecting the target (when true) versus the base card (when false). Consult the spell's documentation for its specific interpretation.

        In other cases, setting this arg to true suppresses the firing of an event. This is used by e.g. ShuffleToDeckSpell to prevent an infinite loop of shuffles for cards like Augmented Elekk.

        In other cases, setting this arg to true only causes the "secondary" effect to occur in the spell. This is used by e.g. ExcessDamageSpell to only deal excess damage instead of both the regular and excess damage.

        Finally, this arg is used by SummonSpell to only summon minions whose card ID is not already present on the casting player's battlefield.

        Use "Find Usages" to see the various ways this arg is used.

      • FILTER

        public static final SpellArg FILTER
        An EntityFilter that is applied to the targets returned by the TARGET or TargetSelection specified on the CardDesc.getTargetSelection(). After filtering, if no targets remain, the spell is not cast; or, if the spell has a target selection specified and no targets are available, the spell typically cannot be cast.

        This arg is interpreted by the spell casting system and never by any Spell class in particular.

        See Also:
        for how this arg is interpreted.

      • FULL_MANA_CRYSTALS

        public static final SpellArg FULL_MANA_CRYSTALS
        When true, indicates to ModifyMaxManaSpell whether it should give a player full or empty mana crystals.

      • HOW_MANY

        public static final SpellArg HOW_MANY
        For spells where VALUE has a separate interpretation from "copies" or "duplicates," this arg is typically used to indicate copies or duplicates.

        Because VALUE is used by SpellUtils.getCards(GameContext, Player, Entity, Entity, SpellDesc, int) to indicate how many random cards should be selected, this arg is typically used to indicate the number of copies of those cards. Therefore, a good rule of thumb is that the number of cards that will be operated on by a SpellUtils.getCards(GameContext, Player, Entity, Entity, SpellDesc, int) call is "value" x "howMany" cards.

        See Also:
        where this arg indicates the number of missiles., where this arg indicates the number of cards that should be shown in a discover.

      • HP_BONUS

        public static final SpellArg HP_BONUS
        Used by BuffSpell to indicate how much additional full-healed health should be given to the target as a buff.

      • IGNORE_SPELL_DAMAGE

        public static final SpellArg IGNORE_SPELL_DAMAGE
        Used by the DamageSpell to indicate that even though this effect is written on a spell card, the amount of damage dealt (the VALUE) should not be affected by spell damage.

      • MANA

        @Deprecated
public static final SpellArg MANA
        Deprecated.
        Used by the CreateCardSpell to indicate how much the card it creates should cost. Considered obsolete.

      • NAME

        public static final SpellArg NAME
        Used by various spells to put a name on a card or to change the name of a target card.
        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • OPERATION

        public static final SpellArg OPERATION
        An AlgebraicOperation that is typically used to do math.

        Currently only used by ModifyDamageSpell.

      • RACE

        public static final SpellArg RACE
        Used by the SetRaceSpell to change a target minion's race.

      • QUEST

        public static final SpellArg QUEST
        Used by AddQuestSpell to define a Quest to put into play.

      • RANDOM_TARGET

        public static final SpellArg RANDOM_TARGET
        When true, indicates that a random single target from the list of filtered targets should be cast on by this spell.

        SummonSpell, when given a CARDS argument, will interpret this arg to mean that a single card should be chosen from the list of cards to summon.

        See Also:
        for the complete targeting rules and how this arg is interpreted.

      • REVERT_TRIGGER

        public static final SpellArg REVERT_TRIGGER
        Used by the RevertableSpell series of spells to indicate which EventTrigger will cause the effects to be "reverted."
        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • SECRET

        public static final SpellArg SECRET
        Used by the AddSecretSpell to define a Secret to put into play.

      • SECOND_REVERT_TRIGGER

        public static final SpellArg SECOND_REVERT_TRIGGER
        Used by the RevertableSpell series of spells to indicate another EventTrigger that will cause the effects to be "reverted."
        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • SECONDARY_NAME

        @Deprecated
public static final SpellArg SECONDARY_NAME
        Deprecated.
        Used by the CreateCardSpell to name the card is creates. Considered obsolete.

      • SECONDARY_TARGET

        public static final SpellArg SECONDARY_TARGET
        Typically interpreted as a second target for effects that have a source, a target, and another entity that does something to the target.

        The EntityReference here is typically interpreted using GameContext.resolveSingleTarget(Player, Entity, EntityReference), a method which returns one entity from "group references" (i.e. EntityReference.isTargetGroup() = true).

        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg., for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • SECONDARY_VALUE

        public static final SpellArg SECONDARY_VALUE
        Indicates a second value. Implements some Reservoir effects and otherwise only used by Swipe spell.

      • SPELL

        public static final SpellArg SPELL
        Typically the SpellDesc that is cast with EntityReference.OUTPUT set to the result of the parent spell's effect; or, the spell that is cast when a Condition is met.
        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • SPELL1

        public static final SpellArg SPELL1
        Like SPELL, a SpellDesc that's typically interpreted as the "first" or primary spell.
        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • SPELL2

        public static final SpellArg SPELL2
        Like SPELL, a SpellDesc that's typically interpreted as the "second" or alternative spell.
        See Also:
        for an exaple of a spell that uses this arg. There, it is cast on the cards the player did not choose.

      • SPELLS

        public static final SpellArg SPELLS
        An array of spells, used almost exclusively by MetaSpell as the spells to cast, one after another, or by ConditionalSpell, cast when the corresponding conditions in CONDITIONS are met.
        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg., for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • SUMMON_BASE_HP

        public static final SpellArg SUMMON_BASE_HP
        For internal use only.

      • SUMMON_BASE_ATTACK

        public static final SpellArg SUMMON_BASE_ATTACK
        For internal use only.

        public static final SpellArg SUMMON_WINDFURY

        For internal use only.

        public static final SpellArg SUMMON_DEATHRATTLE
        For internal use only.

      • SUMMON_AURA

        public static final SpellArg SUMMON_AURA
        For internal use only.

      • TARGET

        public static final SpellArg TARGET
        Specifies the EntityReference on which this spell should be cast, overriding the target received from the parent or selected by the user.

        This entity reference, when a EntityReference.isTargetGroup() group reference, is filtered by FILTER. If the target turns out to be empty or the filtering removes all targets, the spell is not cast.

        See Also:
        for more about how this argument is used.

      • TARGET_PLAYER

        public static final SpellArg TARGET_PLAYER
        Indicates whose point of view this spell should be cast from. Typically becomes the player object in the spell's Spell#cast(GameContext, Player, SpellDesc, Entity, List) implementation onCast.

      • TARGET_SELECTION

        @Deprecated
public static final SpellArg TARGET_SELECTION
        Deprecated.
        Used by the CreateCardSpell to indicate the card's target selection. Considered obsolete.

      • TRIGGER

        public static final SpellArg TRIGGER
        Specifies the EnchantmentDesc enchantment that should be created, typically by the AddEnchantmentSpell.
        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg.

      • GROUP

        public static final SpellArg GROUP
        For internal use only.

      • TRIGGERS

        public static final SpellArg TRIGGERS
        The plural version of TRIGGER.

      • VALUE

        public static final SpellArg VALUE
        The value is either an integer or a ValueProvider which is typically interpreted as the amount or copies of an action.

        For most spells that generate cards using SpellUtils.getCards(GameContext, Player, Entity, Entity, SpellDesc, int), the value is interpreted as the number of cards to select from the randomly generated list. In that case, HOW_MANY is used to indicate copies.

        See Also:
        for an example of a spell that uses this arg to mean amount., for an example of a spell that uses this arg to mean number of copies.

      • BATTLECRY

        public static final SpellArg BATTLECRY
        Specifies a battlecry as a BattlecryDesc that will soon be added by a AddBattlecrySpell.

      • DEATHRATTLE_ID

        public static final SpellArg DEATHRATTLE_ID
        Specifies a unique integer ID for a SpellDesc that is also a deathrattle, to allow deathrattles to identify themselves inside iterators for HasDeathrattleEnchantments.getDeathrattleEnchantments().

    • Method Detail

      • values

        public static SpellArg[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (SpellArg c : SpellArg.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static SpellArg valueOf​(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null
